active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between conducting frequent full recovery tests (high assurance but disruptive) versus periodic verification checks (less disruptive but potentially insufficient). Reference CIS Control 11.3 and NIST SP 800-53 CP-4 to support arguments, and propose a balanced approach for a threat intelligence platform.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Generate 3 plausible distractors: 1) Common misconception (e.g., confuse RTO with RPO), 2) Partial truth/overgeneralization (e.g., 'backups don't need testing if encrypted'), 3) Extreme/unrealistic (e.g., 'test daily full restores').
Base on research context, voter priorities, standards to ensure accuracy.
Avoid random; make challenging for mid-level learners.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate 25 high-quality Anki-style flashcards on 'Backup Verification and Testing' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Platforms > 007_Platform Operations and Management > Backup and Disaster 005_Recovery > Backup Verification and Testing). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above] - Scaffolding Layers: [insert full scaffolding above] - Concept Map: [insert concept_map above] - Research Context: Core concepts (Backup, Verification, Testing, RTO, RPO); Standards (NIST CSF PR.DS-11, NIST SP 800-53 Rev.5 CP-4/CP-9/CP-10; CIS v8 Safeguard 11.1-11.7 fully: 11.1 Practices, 11.2 Automated Backups, 11.3 Verify Integrity/Efficacy, 11.4 Offsite, 11.5 Protect Data, 11.6 Full Test, 11.7 Secure Storage); Sources (NIST CSF 2.0: https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework, NIST SP 800-53 Rev5: https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final, CIS Controls v8: https://www.cisecurity.org/controls). - Active Learning: Draw from for scenario-based cards. Use EXACT Flashcard Schema: Front (MCQ with A/B/C/D, C=correct), Back (Correct Answer + Explanation + Distractors Explained). Follow Distractor Protocol strictly. Ensure Bloom's progression, scaffolding coverage, accuracy (no NIST SP 800-2020 errors). Vary difficulty; include higher-order (analyze/evaluate/create) via scenarios. Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': '...'}, ...]. No extra text.
